verses.verse: One of the seven angels who had the seven cups came to me, saying to me, "Come here; I will show to you the judgment of the great whore who sits on many waters
with whom the kings of the earth committed fornication, and the inhabitants of the earth were made drunk with the wine of her fornication".
So he carried me away in spirit into the wilderness, and I saw a woman sitting on a blood-red beast full with names of blasphemy [and] having seven heads and ten horns.
The woman was arrayed in purple and bright red and decked out with gold, precious stones, and pearls. She had a gold cup in her hand full with abominations and filthiness of her fornication.
On her forehead a name was written: Mystery, Babylon the Great, The Mother of Harlots and Abominations of the Earth.
I saw the woman drunk with the blood of God's people and with the blood of the martyrs of Jesus, and when I saw her, I was bewildered with great wonder.
The angel said to me, "Why were you bewildered? I will tell you the mystery of the woman and the beast that carries her which had the seven heads and ten horns.

"The Beast that you saw was and is not and will rise out of the bottomless pit and go into perdition. Those who live on the earth, those whose names were not written in the book of life from the foundation of the world, will be amazed when they see The Beast that was, is not, and yet is.
"In this [is needed] the mind having wisdom. The seven heads are seven mountains on which the woman sits,
and there are seven kings. Five have fallen, one is [now], [and] the other has yet to come. When he comes, he must continue for a short time.
"The Beast that was and is not, is even the eighth, [who] is [one] of the seven, and goes into perdition.
"The ten horns which you saw are ten kings, who have not yet received a kingdom but will be given authority as kings for one hour with The Beast.
"They have one purpose and will give their power and authority to The Beast.
"These will make war with the Lamb, but the Lamb will overcome them, because he is Lord of lords and King of kings. Those who are with Him are called, chosen, and faithful."
Then he says to me, "The waters you saw, where the whore sits, are peoples, multitudes, nations, and languages.
"The ten horns you saw on the beast will hate the whore and will leave her desolated and naked. They will eat her flesh and burn her with fire,
for God has put it in their hearts to fulfill his will, act together, and give their kingdom to the beast until God's words will be accomplished.
The woman you saw is that great city which reigns over the kings of the earth."
